meanings.definition: To steer a vehicle in a way that causes it to turn less sharply than intended.
meanings.sent1: The driver accidentally understeered the car into the curb.
meanings.sent2: It is important to avoid understeering when navigating sharp turns.
meanings.sent3: The novice driver tended to understeer, making the instructor nervous.
meanings.sent4: Her attempts to understeer through the obstacle course were met with screeching tires.
meanings.sent5: Understeering on icy roads can lead to dangerous situations.

meanings.definition: The tendency of a vehicle to turn less sharply than the driver intends.
meanings.sent1: The car's understeer was noticeable when making tight corners.
meanings.sent2: Drivers should be aware of the potential understeer in slippery conditions.
meanings.sent3: The understeer of the old truck made it challenging to maneuver in the parking lot.
meanings.sent4: The understeer of the boat in rough waters caused it to drift off course.
meanings.sent5: The understeer of the bicycle made it difficult to stay on the path.
